resources.string: 1) When you see a homeless person suffering, what do you do?
2) When you are speaking to someone do you maintain eye contact?
3) How often do you start conversations and hang out with new people?
4) When you are not required to complete an assignment, what do you do?
5) Do you like starting or testing new hobbies or activities?

A simple pose can greatly influence the way that people view you: 
 
 • Anyone can do power poses! They key to understanding their importance lies in the psychological benefit! Power poses can greatly boost your self-esteem and perceived popularity (there are studies that prove it)! 
 
 • So what is a power pose? A power pose is simply an open and wide gesture you can make while communicating or standing alone (click the example below for more details). 
 
 • Doing power poses can boost testosterone levels (hormone that influences social dominance) by 16% and lower cortisol levels (hormone that produces stress and anxiety) by 11%! 
 
 • We all know that attractiveness also plays a major role in popularity. The good news is that power poses boost attractiveness by making you seem more reliable, powerful, and confident! Why? Slumped postures make you seem burdened and less approachable! 
 
 • Did you know that the military prioritizes posture training because it boosts the morale and confidence of soldiers? 
 
 • Fun Fact, animals use wide gestures and open poses to portray dominance! 
 
 • Research from Amy Cuddy's 2012 study on power poses

There's not much that we can do about the voice that we were given, but there is a lot that we can do to improve it! 
 
 • Your voice is an important factor in whether someone will find you appealing and approachable because communication skills are essential to social interactions. 
 
 • First steps first, accept your voice! We were given unique voices and uniqueness contributes to popularity (no one likes an average joe)! 
 
 • A slow and clear voice with intonation (accuracy of pitch) will make an individual appear more confident, dominant, and favorable. 
 
 • Intentional yawning will relax your pharynx and boost your pitch control! 
 
 • Breathing is a major proponent of good speaking. Try diaphragmatic breathing (breathing with your stomach, not chest) to improve the pitch of your voice! 
 
 • Straight postures, keeping your back straight, will also greatly improve your control over your voice because it will maximize your breathing capability (more air better voice)! 
 
 • Evidence from Voice Matters in Dublin, a voice-coaching agency.

You don't need makeup or surgery to boost attractiveness! Just smile! 
 
 • We all love people that can make us smile and be happy! Research shows that all of us have the potential to do that! 
 
 • Sincere smiles boost attractiveness and reliability. 
 
 • Why? Don't doubt the research! Smiling activates the orbitofrontal cortex, the reward center of the brain. So, when you smile you are rewarding someone else, creating a positive environment around you! 
 
 • In the study, Jones and Debruine 2011, research showed that smiling was deemed as more attractive than any other emotion, making the individual seem more friendly and better-looking. 
 
 • Smiling also activates the cingulate cortex in other people, making them smile too! Nothing is better than spreading happiness!

Before we begin the discussion, let's define what gait is so that you have a clear understanding. Gait is a person's manner of walking. Now, you may be asking why we are talking about walking. Let's find out! 
 
 • Psychologists believe that an individual's gait greatly impacts the way that people perceive that individual. 
 
 • People with "perfect" gaits will be perceived as being more confident, open, reverent, and approachable (click the arrow below for an example). 
 
 • What's the evidence you may ask. In a 1935 study by German-born psychologist Werner Wolff, participants were filmed wearing the same clothes and interacting. The video was played back and the participant's head and voice were censored. Participants were then asked to identify an each other's personality and status based on his/her walk. Results showed a high consistency among their judgements. This shows that a person's gait can offer insight into their personality and status! 
 
 • Evidence from: - Thoresen JC, Vuong QC, and Atkinson AP (2012)

This section is different from the others because we will discuss standards for determining personality. Let's dive in and examine the "Big Five " personality traits! 
 
 Neuroticism 
 
 • Measure of one's self confidence, emotional stability, and behaviour. 
 
 • Low scores indicate confidence, while high scores indicate low self-esteem and depression. 
 
 • Those high in neuroticism are generally more favored among their peers. 
 
 
 Opennes to Experience 
 
 • Willingness to take on challenges 
 
 • Likelihood of becoming a leader 
 
 • Desire to see peace and justice 
 
 • Tendency to explore one self and his or her passions 
 
 
 Conscientiousness 
 
 • Tendency to control impulses and follow social norms. 
 
 • People that are conscientious are able to delay gratification (resist temptation) and follow rules. 
 
 • Highly conscientious people are able to succeed in life and attain leadership positions! 
 
 
 Extroversion 
 
 • Where people draw their energy from. 
 
 • Introverts draw their energy from the inner world, gaining satisfaction from solitude. while extroverts gain energy from the outter world, gaining satisfaction from social interactions. 
 
 • People with high extroversion are able to communicate effectively and lead, but people high in introversion are able to reflect and grow as well! 
 
 Agreeableness 
 
 • How people get along with each other! 
 
 • How you interact with people. Examples are kindness, loyalty, patience etc. 
 
 • People high in agreeableness are generally well-liked, respected, and sensitive to other's needs!
